content: easy ribbed hat materials - dk yarn i used double knit special by stylecraft shade 1067 grape thicker yarns can be used and i suggest using the hook size recommended for the yarn - size 5mm crochet hook - tapestry needle - faux fur pom pom click the link for my free guide on how to make a faux fur pom pom dinique co uk - measuring tape for measuring the size - a button for securing the pom pom abbreviations us crochet terms mc magic_ring chain chain slip_stitch slip-stitch single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet blo back loop only gauge 9 half_double_crochet x 6 row = 2 x 2 inches using a 5mm hook and dk yarn the gauge is not that important with this pattern as you will work chains and row until you get the desired length see table below i would suggest that you use the recommended hook size for the yarn that you have selected easy ribbed hat by dinique diane wilks © 2019 please note that this hat has a bit of stretch to it so i made the width slightly smaller size height width finished size allowing for chains/stitches row stretch 1-3 years 9 inches 15 5 inches 18 inches 3-10 years 9 5 inches 16 inches 18 5 inches 10-14 inches useful notes the measurements in the height section above allow for a 2 inch folded brim on the teens and adult sizes and a 1½ inch folded brim on the child sizes if you prefer a slouchier hat increase the starting length chain 1 or 2 at the beginning of the row does not count as a stitch the first stitch is always worked into the same stitch as the chain 1 or 2 most of this pattern is worked in the back loop only however the first and last stitch is worked in both loops to give a neater finish with less holes on the edge of the hat this pattern has a tapered top to give a neater finish with less bulk this pattern is worked around a magic_ring also knows as a magic_ring which makes it easier to cinch the top closed i have added instructions for this but if you can t get on with a magic_ring you can omit this and just chain to start you will then need to weave in and out of the top stitches to cinch the hat together starting with a magic_ring 1 1 hold the end of the yarn 2 between your thumb and middle finger and loop the working yarn over your forefinger 2 bring the working yarn back under your middle finger and over your forefinger again 3 turn your hand over and 3 cross the working yarn 4
